issue.title: Python package on PyPI no longer supports Windows?
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-6233](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6233). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
See <https://pypi.org/project/pyarrow/0.14.1/#files>

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6233?focusedCommentId=16907203) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
That is a correct observation. The wheels for Windows have been removed due to installation problems (see ARROW-6015), and right now there will need to step up new volunteers to fix the windows wheel building. See the mailing list thread at https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/128a2bec285ad45aa4189ebb39a15b39dcf6d91c4ab0278ff4f7cdea@%3Cdev.arrow.apache.org%3E for more discussion.

You can install the precompiled python package on Windows using `conda` (from the conda-forge channel).

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6233?focusedCommentId=16907397) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
The 0.14.0 wheels are still available on Windows, you can install them with `pip install pyarrow==0.14.0`. Hopefully there will be 0.15.0 Windows wheels available if someone is willing to debug the issue we had with 0.14.1
